001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003
004import squidpony.annotation.Beta;
005
006import java.io.Serializable;
007import java.util.ArrayList;
008
009/**
010 * Contains methods to draw anti-aliased lines based on floating-point
011 * coordinates.
012 * <br>
013 * Because of the way this line is calculated, endpoints may be swapped and
014 * therefore the list may not be in start-to-end order.
015 * <br>
016 * Based on work by Hugo Elias at
017 * http://freespace.virgin.net/hugo.elias/graphics/x_wuline.htm which is in turn
018 * based on work by Wu.
019 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
020 */
021@Beta
022public class Elias implements Serializable {
023
024    private static final long serialVersionUID = 5290834334572814012L;
025
026    private ArrayList<Coord> path;
027    private double[][] lightMap;
028    private int width, height;
029    private double threshold = 0.0;
030
031    public Elias() {
032        path = new ArrayList<>();
033    }
034
035    public double[][] lightMap(double startx, double starty, double endx, double endy) {
036        line(startx, starty, endx, endy);
037        return lightMap;
038    }
039
040    /**
041     * Gets the line between the two points.
042     *
043     * @param startx
044     * @param starty
045     * @param endx
046     * @param endy
047     * @return
048     */
049    public ArrayList<Coord> line(double startx, double starty, double endx, double endy) {
050        path.clear();
051        width = (int) (Math.max(startx, endx) + 1);
052        height = (int) (Math.max(starty, endy) + 1);
053        lightMap = new double[width][height];
054        runLine(startx, starty, endx, endy);
055        return path;
056    }
057    /**
058     * Gets the line between the two points.
059     *
060     * @param startx
061     * @param starty
062     * @param endx
063     * @param endy
064     * @param brightnessThreshold between 0.0 (default) and 1.0; only Points with higher brightness will be included
065     * @return
066     */
067    public ArrayList<Coord> line(double startx, double starty, double endx, double endy,
068                                                double brightnessThreshold) {
069        threshold = brightnessThreshold;
070        path.clear();
071        width = (int) (Math.max(startx, endx) + 1);
072        height = (int) (Math.max(starty, endy) + 1);
073        lightMap = new double[width][height];
074        runLine(startx, starty, endx, endy);
075        return path;
076    }
077    public ArrayList<Coord> line(Coord start, Coord end) {
078        return line(start.x, start.y, end.x, end.y);
079    }
080    public ArrayList<Coord> line(Coord start, Coord end, double brightnessThreshold) {
081        return line(start.x, start.y, end.x, end.y, brightnessThreshold);
082    }
083
084    public ArrayList<Coord> getLastPath()
085    {
086        return path;
087    }
088
089    /**
090     * Marks the location as having the visibility given.
091     *
092     * @param x
093     * @param y
094     * @param c
095     */
096    private void mark(double x, double y, double c) {
097        //check bounds overflow from antialiasing
098        if (x >= 0 && x < width && y >= 0 && y < height && c > threshold) {
099            path.add(Coord.get((int) x, (int) y));
100            lightMap[(int) x][(int) y] = c;
101        }
102    }
103
104    private double trunc(double x) {
105        return (int)x;
106//        if (x < 0) {
107//            return Math.ceil(x);
108//        } else {
109//            return Math.floor(x);
110//        }
111    }
112
113    private double frac(double x) {
114        return x - trunc(x);
115    }
116
117    private double invfrac(double x) {
118        return 1 - frac(x);
119    }
120
121    private void runLine(double startx, double starty, double endx, double endy) {
122        double x1 = startx, y1 = starty, x2 = endx, y2 = endy;
123        double grad, xd, yd, xgap, xend, yend, yf, brightness1, brightness2;
124        int x, ix1, ix2, iy1, iy2;
125        boolean shallow = false;
126
127        xd = x2 - x1;
128        yd = y2 - y1;
129
130        if (Math.abs(xd) > Math.abs(yd)) {
131            shallow = true;
132        }
133
134        if (!shallow) {
135            double temp = x1;
136            x1 = y1;
137            y1 = temp;
138            temp = x2;
139            x2 = y2;
140            y2 = temp;
141            xd = x2 - x1;
142            yd = y2 - y1;
143        }
144        if (x1 > x2) {
145            double temp = x1;
146            x1 = x2;
147            x2 = temp;
148            temp = y1;
149            y1 = y2;
150            y2 = temp;
151            xd = x2 - x1;
152            yd = y2 - y1;
153        }
154
155        grad = yd / xd;
156
157        //add the first end point
158        xend = trunc(x1 + .5);
159        yend = y1 + grad * (xend - x1);
160
161        xgap = invfrac(x1 + .5);
162
163        ix1 = (int) xend;
164        iy1 = (int) yend;
165
166        brightness1 = invfrac(yend) * xgap;
167        brightness2 = frac(yend) * xgap;
168
169        if (shallow) {
170            mark(ix1, iy1, brightness1);
171            mark(ix1, iy1 + 1, brightness2);
172        } else {
173            mark(iy1, ix1, brightness1);
174            mark(iy1 + 1, ix1, brightness2);
175        }
176
177        yf = yend + grad;
178
179        //add the second end point
180        xend = trunc(x2 + .5);
181        yend = y2 + grad * (xend - x2);
182
183        xgap = invfrac(x2 - .5);
184
185        ix2 = (int) xend;
186        iy2 = (int) yend;
187
188        //add the in-between points
189        for (x = ix1 + 1; x < ix2; x++) {
190            brightness1 = invfrac(yf);
191            brightness2 = frac(yf);
192
193            if (shallow) {
194                mark(x, (int) yf, brightness1);
195                mark(x, (int) yf + 1, brightness2);
196            } else {
197                mark((int) yf, x, brightness1);
198                mark((int) yf + 1, x, brightness2);
199            }
200
201            yf += grad;
202        }
203        
204        brightness1 = invfrac(yend) * xgap;
205        brightness2 = frac(yend) * xgap;
206
207        if (shallow) {
208            mark(ix2, iy2, brightness1);
209            mark(ix2, iy2 + 1, brightness2);
210        } else {
211            mark(iy2, ix2, brightness1);
212            mark(iy2 + 1, ix2, brightness2);
213        }
214
215    }
216}
